Exaggerate: The claim in the ad exaggerates the extent of the tax freeze by implying that it applies to the entire property tax bill, when in reality it only applies to a portion of the levies.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of freezing only a portion of the property tax levies by not clarifying that it would not contain overall tax bills for property owners in the city.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to demonstrate how freezing a portion of the property tax levies would effectively keep families in their homes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that freezing a portion of the property tax levies will directly benefit families and prevent them from losing their homes, without providing a clear explanation of how this would work.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that freezing a portion of the property tax levies may not be the most effective or comprehensive solution to address the issue of families losing their homes, as other factors such as economic conditions and housing affordability also play a significant role.
